Males: fore femur with a pair of spines in proximal third, one spine on distal third dorsally; fore tibia with a pair of spines on distal margin; palar claw knife-shaped. Median lobe of sternite VII with a pointed apex and one long seta (see
Chen et al . 2015
: fig. 58). Free lobe large, apically broadened, posterior margin produced into an obtuse angle, lateral angle with 10–15 long setae ( Fig. 3A ). Left paramere: shaft slender, constricted pre-apically, apex slightly twisted ( Fig. 3C ). Right paramere: shaft evenly curved, from distal fourth tapering towards narrowly rounded apex ( Fig. 3B ).
